abstract.text: Gets part of the data from a chunk in an audio file.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: The audio file whose chunk you want to get data from.
The four-character code of the designated chunk.
An index that specifies which chunk with the four-character code specified in the
parameter you want to query.
An offset from the first byte of the chunk to the first byte to get.
On input, a pointer to the size of the buffer that contains the designated chunk. On output, a pointer to the size of bytes that the system copied to the buffer.
A pointer to a buffer in which to copy the chunk data.
A result code if there’s an error (see Result Codes) or
if the operation succeeds.
See
for an example of using this function to parse the Audio Definition Model (ADM) of a BW64 file, which is 64-bit and based on WAVE.

abstract.text: Record or play audio, convert formats, parse audio streams, and configure your audio session.
Gets the number of user data items with a specified ID in a file.
Gets a chunk from an audio file.
Gets part of the data from a chunk in an audio file.
Gets the size of a user data item in an audio file.
Gets the size of a user data item in an audio file.
An opaque data type that represents an audio file object.
Removes a user data item from an audio file.
Sets a user data item in an audio file.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
A raw pointer for accessing and manipulating untyped data.

inlineContent.text: The audio file whose chunk you want to get data from.
The four-character code of the designated chunk.
An index that specifies which chunk with the four-character code specified in the
parameter you want to query.
An offset from the first byte of the chunk to the first byte to get.
On input, a pointer to the size of the buffer that contains the designated chunk. On output, a pointer to the size of bytes that the system copied to the buffer.
A pointer to a buffer in which to copy the chunk data.
A result code if there’s an error (see Result Codes) or
if the operation succeeds.
